title: ReproRes 2024
text:
Class 01 (2024-09-27)

Pre-Class

Make sure you can access Moodle
Bookmark the Teams channel for PSYCH5077 and Introduce yourself
Read the overview and Chapter 1 of the textbook
Install R and RStudio on your computer

post on Teams if you run into problems
if you don’t have a personal computer, you can use university computers; log on and familiarise yourself with R and RStudio
If you have a chromebook or tablet, you can’t install R, but can use the RStudio server (log in with your GUID)

Download and render the test file to check that your setup is accurate
Add these assessment dates to your diary

2024-10-09 (10%) A project with a qmd file showing basic reproducible report skills (chapters 1-2)
2024-10-23 (20%) A project demonstrating data visualisation and summary skills (chapters 3-4)
2024-11-13 (30%) A project demonstrating data wrangling skills (chapters 5-7)
2024-12-11 (40%) A project showing power simulation (chapters 8-10)

Fill out the pre-class poll



In-Class

Poll 1
Open the class book
Open RStudio
Start at 13:05
Why Code? presentation
Discuss the class syllabus
Break
Chapter 1 live code



Class Notes

log into desktops with campus\12345678X and GUID password

title: PT Data
text:
ct <- cols(
  HB = col_character(),
  Month = col_date(),
  ReferralsAccepted = col_integer(),
  ReferralsAcceptedQF = col_character(),
  ReferralsReceived = col_integer(),
  ReferralsReceivedQF = col_character()
)

pt_data <- read_csv("data/pt-referrals.csv",
                    show_col_types = FALSE,
                    #col_types = ct,
                    na = c("", "missing", "Missing", "missing "))

title: PT Data
text:
ct <- cols(
  HB = col_character(),
  Month = col_date(),
  ReferralsAccepted = col_integer(),
  ReferralsAcceptedQF = col_character(),
  ReferralsReceived = col_integer(),
  ReferralsReceivedQF = col_character()
)

pt_data <- read_csv("data/pt-referrals.csv",
                    show_col_types = FALSE,
                    #col_types = ct,
                    na = c("", "missing", "Missing", "missing "))

title: PT Data
text:
Referrals by Month

monthly <- summarise(pt_data, .by = Month,
                     received = sum(ReferralsReceived, na.rm = TRUE),
                     accepted = sum(ReferralsAccepted, na.rm = TRUE)) |>
  mutate(date = ymd(Month*100 + 1),
         pcnt = accepted / received)


ggplot(monthly, aes(x = date, y = received)) +
  geom_line()

title: Ch 5 Exercises
text: library(tidyverse)

title: Ch 5 Exercises
text:
Load Data

schedule <- read_csv("data/scheduleA.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)
grades1 <- read_csv("data/grade_data1.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) |>
  mutate(id = gsub("[a-z]", "", id) |> as.numeric())
grades2 <- read_csv("data/grade_data2.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)

title: Ch 5 Exercises
Ch 5 Exercises
text:
Joined essay and exam



id
Points_exam
Grade_exam
Points_essay
Grade_essay




…
…
…
…
…




completes <- inner_join(exam_all, essay_all, 
                        by = join_by(id), 
                        suffix = c("_exam", "_essay")) |>
  select(id, exam = Grade_exam, essay = Grade_essay)


no_essay <- exam_all |>
  anti_join(essay_all, by = "id")


no_exam <- essay_all |>
  anti_join(exam_all, by = "id")

both_essay_exam <- semi_join(exam_all, essay_all, by = "id")


test <- full_join(grades1, grades2, by = "id", 
                  suffix = c("_exam", "_essay")) |>
  filter(is.na(Points_exam),
         !is.na(Points_essay))
